IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF ALL LITTLE VILLAGE RESIDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ENLACE CHICAGO CONVENES, ORGANIZES, AND BUILDS THE CAPACITY OF LITTLE VILLAGE STAKEHOLDERS TO CONFRONT SYSTEMIC INEQUITIES AND BARRIERS TO ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL ACCESS. ENLACE CHICAGO IS DEDICATED TO MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF LITTLE VILLAGE RESIDENTS BY FOSTERING A SAFE AND HEALTHY ENVIRONMENT AND BY CHAMPIONING OPPORTUNITIES FOR EDUCATIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION: ENLACE PROMOTES A STRONG CULTURE OF EDUCATION IN LITTLE VILLAGE BY PARTNERING WITH LOCAL PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND SUPPORTING SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION TO HIGH SCHOOL, POST-SECONDARY AND BEYOND. COMMUNITY SCHOOLS ARE SAFE, ACCESSIBLE COMMUNITY CENTERS THAT PROVIDE WRAP-AROUND FAMILY PROGRAMMING THAT PROMOTES ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SKILL BUILDING, SOCIAL EMOTIONAL LEARNING AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT. POST-SECONDARY COORDINATORS PROVIDE TAILORED SUPPORT TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO FACE BARRIERS IN GETTING TO COLLEGE, INCLUDING THOSE WHO ARE UNDOCUMENTED. PARENTS ARE ENGAGED AS CLASSROOM AIDES, PEER MENTORS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND RECEIVE TRAINING RELATED TO TOPICS SUCH AS POST-SECONDARY ATTAINMENT, SOCIAL EMOTIONAL LEARNING, AND ORGANIZING AND ADVOCACY. THROUGH SYSTEM ALIGNMENT, RESEARCH AND POLICY ADVOCACY, THE LITTLE VILLAGE EDUCATION COLLABORATIVE WORKS WITH STAKEHOLDERS TO IMPROVE THE EDUCATION SYSTEM IN LITTLE VILLAGE AND ENHANCE EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT FROM BIRTH TO OLD AGE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: VIOLENCE PREVENTION: ENLACE TAKES A COMPREHENSIVE AND TRAUMA-INFORMED APPROACH TO BUILDING SAFETY AND PROMOTING PEACE IN LITTLE VILLAGE. STREET OUTREACH WORKERS FOCUS ON REDUCING AND PREVENTING GUN VIOLENCE BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, PARTNERS AND OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE MOST IMPACTED. MASTER'S LEVEL SOCIAL WORKERS PROVIDE CLINICAL MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, INCLUDING COUNSELING AND WORKSHOPS, FOR STUDENTS, FAMILIES AND STAFF IN LOCAL SCHOOLS. SOCIAL WORKERS PROVIDE MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES IN OTHER ACCESSIBLE COMMUNITY LOCATIONS FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE HIGH NEED. A SAFE PASSAGE TEAM WORKS TO IMPROVE SAFETY ALONG THE ROUTES THAT STUDENTS AND FAMILIES TRAVEL TO AND FROM SCHOOL. THE VIOLENCE PREVENTION COLLABORATIVE AND THE LITTLE VILLAGE YOUTH SAFETY NETWORK CONVENE STAKEHOLDERS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT COORDINATED STRATEGIES THAT PROMOTE PEACE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE PANDEMIC RESPONSE/COMMUNITY CARE TEAM ADDRESSED THE COMMUNITY NEEDS RELATED TO THE ADVERSE EFFECTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. RESOURCES INCLUDE HOUSING ASSISTANCE, CASH ASSISTANCE, SHARING OF RESOURCES FROM OTHER AGENCIES, AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER AGENCIES TO PROVIDE COVID TESTING, VACCINATIONS, AND ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ORGANIZING AND ADVOCACY: ENLACE ORGANIZES COMMUNITY-BASED WORKSHOPS, PROVIDES FREE LEGAL SERVICES AND ENGAGES IN POLICY ADVOCACY THAT BENEFITS IMMIGRANT FAMILIES. THE FREE LEGAL CLINIC PROVIDES A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES IN THE AREAS OF IMMIGRATION, FAMILY, EDUCATION, LABOR, CRIMINAL RECORDS, HOUSING AND CONSUMER ISSUES. ATTORNEYS AND STAFF SUPPORT COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH IMMIGRATION APPLICATION PROCESSES SUCH AS ADJUSTMENT OF STATUS, CITIZENSHIP AND THE U-VISA. EDUCATIONAL SESSIONS PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO LEARN ABOUT AND DISCUSS TOPICS SUCH AS "KNOW YOUR RIGHTS AND CURRENT IMMIGRATION POLICY. COMMUNITY LEADERS WORK WITH STAFF TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT ENLACE'S IMMIGRATION ADVOCACY PLATFORM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND, THEREFORE, HAS NOT RECORDED A LIABILITY FOR ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENLACE CHICAGO CREATED A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS AND ALL ORGANIZATIONS SUBMITTED A FORMAL APPLICATION. SUBGRANTS WERE AWARDED TO COALITION PARTNERS IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE OVERARCHING GRANT GUIDELINES. ORGANIZATIONS WERE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT PROOF OF 501(C)(3) STATUS AND GOOD STANDING WITH THE ILLINOIS SECRETARY OF STATE. THE INITIAL GRANT PAYMENT WAS CONTINGENT ON A SIGNED MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING (MOU) INCLUDING AN AGREEMENT ON OUTCOMES, SCOPE OF SERVICE, AND PROPOSED BUDGET. FURTHER PAYMENTS WERE CONTINGENT ON MOU COMPLIANCE, WHICH WAS CONFIRMED THROUGH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE REPORTING SUBMITTED BY THE GRANTEE. INDIVIDUAL GRANTS WERE RELEASED AFTER AN APPLICATION HAD BEEN SUBMITTED TO A COALITION EXECUTIVE WHO THEN REVIEWED AND DETERMINED THE AWARD AMOUNT. INDIVIDUALS WERE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT FORM W-9S.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE 990 IS GIVEN TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND REVIEWED AT A BOARD MEETING BEFORE IT IS SUBMITTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR MANAGEMENT IS EVALUATED AND DECIDED UPON ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE CFO PROVIDES DATA SHOWING COMPENSATION FOR LEADERSHIP AT SIMILARLY SIZED ORGANIZATIONS, AND ORGANIZATIONS WITH SIMILAR MISSIONS. THE CFO ALSO PROVIDES THE SOURCES OF THEIR RESEARCH. THE BOARD TREASURER THEN MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR COMPENSATION. THE BOARD VOTES TO APPROVE, AND MINUTES ARE KEPT OF THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION AMOUNTS AND THE APPROVED AMOUNTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL FORMS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGE 1, SECTION B - AMENDED RETURN
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS FILING AN AMENDED RETURN FOR 2021 DUE TO CHANGES MADE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION AS A RESULT OF THE COMPLETION OF ITS ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT. THE ORGANIZATION'S TOTAL ASSETS DECREASED $26,123; TOTAL LIABILITIES DECREASED $24,007; AND TOTAL NET ASSETS DECREASED BY $2,116. THESE CHANGES TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BALANCE SHEET RESULTED FROM AN INCREASE IN CONTRIBUTION REVENUE OF $304,501; AN INCREASE IN INVESTMENT INCOME OF $12,302; AN INCREASE IN OTHER REVENUE OF $355; AND A DECREASE IN EXPENSES OF $242,893. A PRIOR PERIOD ADJUSTMENT OF $250,000 WAS ALSO IDENTIFIED WITHIN CONTRIBUTION REVENUE AND RECEIVABLES. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION UNDERWENT A SINGLE AUDIT AS PART OF ITS ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT.
